      • scaleImage

        boolean scaleImage(java.lang.String sessionId,
                   AdminScaleOptions scaleOptions)
            throws KKAdminException
        Scale the specified image to the specified name and dimensions. Supported image extensions are: JPG, JPEG, GIF and PNG.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        scaleOptions - The scaling options
        Returns:
        true if the file was scaled and created successfully
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • addImage

        void addImage(java.lang.String sessionId,
              AdminImageOptions options)
       throws KKAdminException
        Add the image to the object defined in the AdminImageOptions object.

        When adding product images it uses the same conventions as used in the Admin Application and gets these definitions from the konakartadmin_gwt.properties file. Once an image is added to a product using this API the image will appear for the product in the Admin Application just as if it had been added via an image upload in the Admin application.

        See AdminImageOptions for details on the options for adding images.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        options - The options that define which object the image should be added to
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine if the image was not added successfully

      • removeImage

        void removeImage(java.lang.String sessionId,
                 AdminImageOptions options)
          throws KKAdminException
        Remove the image (or images) from the object defined in the AdminImageOptions object.

        See AdminImageOptions for details on the options for removing images.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        options - The options that define which images should be removed
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine for any unexpected problems

      • getJobStatus

        AdminJobStatusResponse getJobStatus(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                    AdminJobStatusRequest jobStatusRequest)
                             throws KKAdminException
        Retrieve information on the Batch Jobs running in the system.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        jobStatusRequest - Defines the jobs to retrieve information about
        Returns:
        AdminJobStatusResponse an object defining the status of the jobs requested. The AdminJobStatusResponse object returned contains an array of AdminJob objects. This array is always returned instantiated but may contain no elements.
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getRMACode

        java.lang.String getRMACode(java.lang.String sessionId,
                            int orderId)
                     throws KKAdminException
        This method may be customized in the OrderIntegrationMgr to implement an algorithm that creates an RMA code for the order. The Administration Application will use the returned value (if not null) to automatically populate the RMA code entry field when inserting a new Return object.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        orderId - Id of the order
        Returns:
        Returns an RMA Code
        Throws:

      • getContentTypes

        AdminContentTypeSearchResult getContentTypes(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                             AdminContentTypeSearch search,
                                             AdminDataDescriptor dataDesc)
                                      throws KKAdminException
        Returns an array of AdminContentType records matching the search criteria. If no records are found an empty array is returned.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        search - an AdminContentTypeSearch object
        dataDesc - an AdminDataDescriptor object. You can set the order using one of:
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_ID_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_ID_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_NAME_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_NAME_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM1_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM1_DESCENDING
        Returns:
        Returns an AdminContentSearchTypeResult object containing an array of content type records matching the search criteria. If there are no records an empty array is returned within the AdminContentTypeSearchResult.
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • updateContentType

        void updateContentType(java.lang.String sessionId,
                       AdminContentType content)
                throws KKAdminException
        Update an AdminContentType object
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        content - an AdminContentType object
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getCouponCode

        java.lang.String getCouponCode(java.lang.String sessionId,
                               java.lang.String options)
                        throws KKAdminException
        This method may be customized in the OrderIntegrationMgr to implement an algorithm that creates a coupon code or to read a coupon code from an external source.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        options - Optional parameter that may be used to control how the coupon code is generated
        Returns:
        Returns a coupon code
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • createMailingList

        void createMailingList(java.lang.String sessionId,
                       AdminCustomerSearch search,
                       AdminMailListOptions listOptions)
                throws KKAdminException
        Create a mailing list file on disk that contains a record for every customer defined by the AdminCustomerSearch object.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        search - Customer search object - defines the set of customers to be included in the mailing list to be created
        listOptions - Mailing List Options - defines options about the mailing list to be created such as its format and its name.
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • addCatalogRules

        void addCatalogRules(java.lang.String sessionId,
                     java.lang.String catalogId,
                     AdminCatalogRule[] rules)
              throws KKAdminException
        The purpose of this method is to add an array of rules to a catalog so that it can be created automatically using createCatalogPricesFromRules() using the rules to make price adjustments to products within selected categories and to include or exclude products from selected categories.

        For each category a rule allows you to:

        • Include or exclude products from that category and all subcategories
        • Make a percentage price adjustment (up or down) for all products in the category and subcategories
        • Add a fixed price for all products in the category and subcategories
        If a product is in more than one category then we determine whether one of the categories is invisible and use the price rules from that category. This allows an administrator to include special cases for individual products by placing them in invisible categories.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        catalogId - The alphanumeric catalog identifier to which the rules apply
        rules - An array of rules
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getCatalogRules

        AdminCatalogRule[] getCatalogRules(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                   java.lang.String catalogId)
                            throws KKAdminException
        The purpose of this method is fetch an array of catalog rules which are used by createCatalogPricesFromRules() to automatically create the catalog using the rules to make price adjustments to products within selected categories and to include or exclude products from selected categories.

        For each category a rule allows you to:

        • Include or exclude products from that category and all subcategories
        • Make a percentage price adjustment (up or down) for all products in the category and subcategories
        • Add a fixed price for all products in the category and subcategories
        If a product is in more than one category then we determine whether one of the categories is invisible and use the price rules from that category. This allows an administrator to include special cases for individual products by placing them in invisible categories. *
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        catalogId - The alphanumeric catalog identifier
        Returns:
        Returns an array of catalog rules sorted by category id ascending
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • createCatalogPricesFromRules

        AdminCreateCatalogPricesResult createCatalogPricesFromRules(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                                            java.lang.String catalogId,
                                                            AdminCreateCatalogPriceOptions options)
                                                     throws KKAdminException
        This method populates a catalog with product prices based on rules that have been previously added using the addCatalogRules() method. The rules are used to make price adjustments to products within selected categories and to include or exclude products from selected categories.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        catalogId - Id of the catalog
        options - The options object allows you to configure the following functionality:
        • All products are read from the database in a loop to add to the catalog. You can define the maximum number of records read at a time. It can be changed for performance reasons based on the specs of your system and number of products in your database.
        • When running the Solr search engine you can force a reload of the products once the new prices have been generated.
        • In some cases it's convenient to create prices dynamically when a user logs into the system. The options object allows you to specify a time period so that new prices are only created if that time period has elapsed since the last creation time.
        Returns:
        Returns an object containing the number of products added to the catalog and the id of the catalog
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getFilters

        AdminFilterSearchResult getFilters(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                   AdminFilterSearch search,
                                   AdminDataDescriptor dataDesc)
                            throws KKAdminException
        Returns an array of filter records matching the search criteria. If no records are found an empty array is returned.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        search - an AdminFilterSearch object
        dataDesc - an AdminDataDescriptor object

        The returned filters may be sorted by:

        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_ORDER_ID_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_ORDER_ID_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOMERS_ID_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOMERS_ID_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_TABLE_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_TABLE_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_COLUMN_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_COLUMN_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CONSTRAINT_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CONSTRAINT_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM1_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM1_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM2_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM3_DESCENDING
        Returns:
        Returns an AdminFilterSearchResult object containing an array of filter records matching the search criteria. If there are no records an empty array is returned within the AdminFilterSearchResult.
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getFiltersForCustomer

        AdminFilter[] getFiltersForCustomer(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                    int custId)
                             throws KKAdminException
        Returns an array of filter records matching the search criteria. If no records are found an empty array is returned.

        Returns:
        Returns the filters belonging to the specified customer. If there are no records an empty array is returned.

        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • addChildrenToCustomer

        void addChildrenToCustomer(java.lang.String sessionId,
                           int parentId,
                           AdminCustomer[] children)
                    throws KKAdminException
        The array of AdminCustomer children objects are given the parent id passed in as a parameter. Any existing child of the parent that isn't in the array, is deleted. Only the id of the children objects needs to be populated.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session Id of the user.
        parentId - ParentId set on the AdminCustomer children objects passed in as a parameter
        children - An array of AdminCustomer objects
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getStoreTime

        java.util.Calendar getStoreTime()
                         throws KKAdminException
        Returns the local store time based on the tz database time zone of the store. A list can be found here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones . They are in a string format and look like US/Pacific, Australia/Perth, Europe/London etc. and observe DST.
        Returns:
        Returns a Calendar object for the current store time
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getVendors

        AdminVendorSearchResult getVendors(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                   AdminVendorSearch vendorSearch,
                                   int offset,
                                   int size)
                            throws KKAdminException
        Search for vendors matching a set of search criteria within the AdminVendorSearch object. The vendors may be sorted by :
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_NAME_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_NAME_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_TAX_CODE_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_TAX_CODE_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_COMPANY_ID_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_COMPANY_ID_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_STOREID_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_STOREID_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_RATING_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_RATING_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM1_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM1_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM2_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM2_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM3_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM3_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM4_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM4_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM5_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOM5_DESCENDING
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        vendorSearch - The definition of the search for vendors - can be null
        offset - The offset in the database
        size - The number of records from the specified offset
        Returns:
        Returns a set of vendors customers matching the search criteria within an AdminVendorSearchResult object
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getVendorReviews

        AdminReviews getVendorReviews(java.lang.String sessionId,
                              AdminDataDescriptor dataDesc,
                              AdminReviewSearch revSearch)
                       throws KKAdminException
        Returns the reviews for the given search criteria. The AdminReviewSearch object allows you search for reviews by:
        • id
        • vendorId
        • customerId
        • rating
        • status
          • com.konakartadmin.bl.KonakartAdminConstants.REVIEW_VISIBLE = The review can be seen by customers in the storefront application
          • com.konakartadmin.bl.KonakartAdminConstants.REVIEW_INVISIBLE = The review cannot be seen by customers in the storefront application. It is waiting to be approved.
          • com.konakartadmin.bl.KonakartAdminConstants.REVIEW_INVISIBLE_REJECTED = The review cannot be seen by customers in the storefront application. It has been rejected.
        The AdminDataDescriptor allows to add search constraints for the custom fields 1 to 3 and to order the result set as follows:
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_DATE_ADDED
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_DATE_ADDED_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_DATE_ADDED_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_TIMES_READ
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_RATING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_RATING_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_RATING_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_REVIEWID_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_REVIEWID_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_STATUS_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_STATUS_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOMERS_ID_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_CUSTOMERS_ID_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_VENDOR_ID_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_VENDOR_ID_DESCENDING
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        dataDesc - Used to control the data offset, limit the number of items returned and set the sort order
        revSearch - The search criteria
        Returns:
        Return an AdminReviews object
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getVendorReview

                                 int vendorId)
                          throws KKAdminException

        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_DATE_ADDED
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_DATE_ADDED_DESCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_DATE_ADDED_ASCENDING

        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_RATING

        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_RATING_ASCENDING
        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_REVIEWID_ASCENDING

        • AdminDataDescriptor.ORDER_BY_STATUS_DESCENDING

      • addVendorToStore

        void addVendorToStore(java.lang.String sessionId,
                      int vendorId,
                      java.lang.String vendorStoreId)
               throws KKAdminException
        Associates a vendor with a store. A check is made to see whether the store and vendor exist. A vendorId of zero is accepted and represents the case where the store has no associated vendor.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        vendorId - The numeric vendor id
        vendorStoreId - The store id for the Vendor
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • insertCatalogPrices

        void insertCatalogPrices(java.lang.String sessionId,
                         AdminProductPrice[] prices,
                         AdminInsertCatalogPriceOptions options)
                  throws KKAdminException
        This API call is intended to provide a fast way to load catalog prices. In order to maximize for speed, a check isn't made to see whether the product, productAttr and tierPrice ids actually exist. For each price in the array, an attempt is first made to update the catalog price. If it doesn't already exist in the database, it is inserted.

        The options object allows you:

        • Manage the transaction. When the singleTransaction attribute is set to true, the prices are updated / inserted within a single database transaction and a rollback is performed if an exception is caught. When false, the API call terminates as soon as an exception is caught, but no rollback is performed. The default is false.
        • Decide whether to insert a product update event. When the insertKKEvent attribute is set to true, a product update event is inserted for all products which have had price changes. The event ensures that the product is removed from the cache in order to pick up the new prices. The default is false.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        prices - An array of AdminProductPrice objects
        options - Allows you to manage the transaction and events. May be left empty for default behaviour.
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • cloneCustomer

        AdminCloneCustomerResult cloneCustomer(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                       int cloneCustId,
                                       java.lang.String[] stores)
                                throws KKAdminException
        This API call is used to clone customers across multiple stores and is only available when in multi-store single DB, non shared customer mode. The caller (referenced by sessionId) must have at least one role with super user privileges. The cloneCustId references an existing customer in the current engine store. If a customer with matching eMail address doesn't exist in a destination store, a new customer object is inserted, otherwise the existing object is updated.

        Points to note:

        • The cloned customer has the same password as the source customer
        • All addresses and roles are also cloned
        • Customer tag information is cloned as long as the customer tag exists in the destination store
        • The return object contains an array of error messages. If an error occurs when cloning to a store, the exception is trapped, reported in the return object and the code continues with the next store.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user which must have Super User privileges.
        cloneCustId - The id of the customer to be cloned
        stores - An array of destination store ids where the customer will be cloned
        Returns:
        Returns an AdminCloneCustomerResult object
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • deleteCustomerMultiStore

        AdminDeleteCustomerResult deleteCustomerMultiStore(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                                   int customerId,
                                                   java.lang.String[] stores)
                                            throws KKAdminException
        This API call is used to delete customers across multiple stores and is only available when in multi-store single DB, non shared customer mode. The caller (referenced by sessionId) must have at least one role with super user privileges. The customerId references an existing customer in the current engine store. If a customer with matching eMail address exists in a destination store, the customer is deleted.

        If the stores array contains the id of the KKAdmin Engine store, then the customer is also deleted from that store.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user which must have Super User privileges.
        customerId - The id of the customer to be deleted
        stores - An array of store ids where the customer will be deleted
        Returns:
        Returns an AdminDeleteCustomerResult object
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getStoresForCustomer

        AdminStore[] getStoresForCustomer(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                  java.lang.String emailAddress)
                           throws KKAdminException
        This API call is only available when in multi-store single DB, non shared customer mode. The caller (referenced by sessionId) must have at least one role with super user privileges.

        It is used to search for a customer using the email address, across multiple stores. The stores where the customer is present, are returned in an array in alphabetical order. It searches all stores regardless of their state (enabled, under maintenance or deleted). This state information is available on the returned AdminStore objects.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user which must have Super User privileges.
        emailAddress - The email address of the customer being searched
        Returns:
        Returns an array of AdminStores. An empty array is returned if there are no stores.
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getSuggestions

        AdminSuggestionSearchResult getSuggestions(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                           AdminSuggestion suggestion,
                                           AdminDataDescriptor dataDesc)
                                    throws KKAdminException
        This retrieves Product Recommendation AdminSuggestion objects from the database.

        The suggestions that are retrieved are defined by the suggestion parameter. The where clause for the select will be created by using the values in the suggestion parameter.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        suggestion - Used to define the search
        dataDesc - data descriptor for defining generic search parameters such as size and offset
        Returns:
        an AdminSuggestionSearchResult that contains the result of the search
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • insertSuggestions

        void insertSuggestions(java.lang.String sessionId,
                       AdminSuggestion[] suggestions)
                throws KKAdminException
        This inserts Product Recommendation AdminSuggestion objects into the database. The suggestionType attribute must be set in the AdminSuggestion objects in the array.

        For Product Suggestion types the boughtProductId attribute must be set on the AdminSuggestion objects.

        For Customer Suggestion types the customerId attribute must be set on the AdminSuggestion objects.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        suggestions - An array of AdminSuggestion objects
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • deleteSuggestions

        void deleteSuggestions(java.lang.String sessionId,
                       AdminSuggestion suggestion)
                throws KKAdminException
        This deletes Product Recommendation Suggestion records from the database. The suggestions that are deleted are defined by the AdminSuggestion record. The where clause for the delete will be created by using the values in the AdminSuggestion.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        suggestion - An AdminSuggestion object that is used to specify the records to delete.
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getOrderReturnStatuses

        AdminOrderReturnStatusSearchResult getOrderReturnStatuses(AdminOrderReturnStatusSearch search)
                                                   throws KKAdminException
        Returns an AdminOrderReturnStatusSearchResult object.
        Parameters:
        search - the search object that defines the search parameters and sort order. If languageId is not set (or set to AdminLanguageMgr.DEFAULT_LANG) the default language is used. If the languageId is set to AdminLanguageMgr.ALL_LANGUAGES all languages are returned.
        Returns:
        Returns an AdminOrderReturnStatusSearchResult
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

                            int id)

      • insertOrderReturnStatus

        int insertOrderReturnStatus(java.lang.String sessionId,
                            AdminOrderReturnStatus status)
                     throws KKAdminException
        Insert an OrderReturnStatus object. You may select the order status id or alternatively set the id of the object to -1 in order for the system to assign an Id. An exception will be thrown if the selected id already exists.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        status - An OrderReturnStatus object
        Returns:
        returns the order status id of the inserted object
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • insertOrderReturnStatuses

        int insertOrderReturnStatuses(java.lang.String sessionId,
                              AdminOrderReturnStatus[] statuses)
                       throws KKAdminException
        Insert an array of AdminOrderReturnStatus objects. This method is useful to insert an object for each language defined in the system. All members of the array must have the same order status id. You may select the order status id or alternatively set the id of the objects to -1 in order for the system to assign an Id. An exception will be thrown if the selected id already exists.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        statuses - An array of AdminOrderReturnStatus objects
        Returns:
        returns the order status id of the inserted AdminOrderReturnStatus objects
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • updateOrderReturnStatus

        int updateOrderReturnStatus(java.lang.String sessionId,
                            AdminOrderReturnStatus status)
                     throws KKAdminException
        Update an OrderReturnStatus object.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session Id of the logged in user
        status - An OrderReturnStatus object
        Returns:
        returns the id of the updated object
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine

      • getAllOrderReturnStatuses

        AdminOrderReturnStatus[] getAllOrderReturnStatuses(int languageId)
                                            throws KKAdminException
        Returns an array of AdminOrderReturnStatus objects for the specified languageId. Use AdminLanguageMgr.ALL_LANGUAGES to retrieve the Order Status Names for All languages.
        Parameters:
        languageId - the languageId
        Returns:
        an array of AdminOrderReturnStatus objects for the specified languageId.
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - an unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin engine
